subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] get your news in QS!
msgSnippet: ... True! But when I think that I might have read words like about tens of thousands (100 s of thousands? a million?) times, I have a bit of catching up to
messageBody:
Moira O'Brien wrote:
>
>
> Reading is a matter of constant practice. I have used QS since the 60's
> yet I have never since the early 70's read it on a regular basis. So
> while I can write it fluently, I only read it haltingly.
>
> So, practice practice practice - unitl word recognitions becomes a fact.
> In this respect, your news is a great resource to have, so many thanks
> again.

True! But when I think that I might have read words like "about" tens of
thousands (100's of thousands? a million?) times, I have a bit of
catching up to do to be able to read QS. Right now I read at something
like a 2nd grade level, with the exception that I can guess a lot of
longer words by context a 2nd grader couldn't. ("It seems in this case
we did everything by the book," I read today. How many times have I seen
that cliche--so I could zoom right over it.)

Paul
